intro: Gnaphalium chrysocephalum, commonly known as goldenhead fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellow to golden flowers that are clustered in a spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
